name: Rational Numbers on the Coordinate Plane

skills.name: Describe a point in the first quadrant of a 2D grid by giving its coordinates, where at least one value is not an integer
Mark a point in the second quadrant of a 2D grid having been given its coordinates, where at least one value is not an integer
Describe a point in the third quadrant of a 2D grid by giving its coordinates, where at least one value is not an integer
Describe a point in the fourth quadrant of a 2D grid by giving its coordinates, where at least one value is not an integer
Mark a point in the fourth quadrant of a 2D grid having been given its coordinates, where at least one value is not an integer

explanations.A: Not quite - it isn't on EXACTLY 3 so we need to think a little bit further on.
explanations.B: It is a little bit further on than 3 but not quite halfway between 3 and 4, which means the most reasonable answer from this list is 3 1/3.
explanations.C: Not quite - it isn't exactly halfway between 3 and 4 so couldn't be 3.5. Think a little bit closer to 3!
explanations.D: I think you've given the 洧녽 coordinate here which is the axis going up. The 洧논 axis is the one that goes across.

explanations.A: Not quite - it isn't exactly halfway between 1 and 2 so couldn't be 1.5. Think a little bit closer to 1!
explanations.B: I think you've given the 洧논 coordinate here which is the axis going across. The 洧녽 axis is the one that goes up.
explanations.C: Not quite - it isn't on EXACTLY 1 so we need to think a little bit further on.
explanations.D: It is a little bit further on than 1 but not quite halfway between 1 and 2, which means the most reasonable answer from this list is 1 1/3.

explanations.A: I think you've given the 洧논 coordinate here which is the axis going across. The 洧녽 axis is the one that goes up.
explanations.B: Not quite - it isn't on EXACTLY -2 so we need to think a little bit further on.
explanations.C: Not quite - it isn't on EXACTLY -3 so we need to think a little bit before that.
explanations.D: The coordinate is roughly halfway between -2 and -3, which would make it -2.5.

explanations.A: The coordinate is roughly halfway between 2 and 3, which would make it 2.5.
explanations.B: Not quite - it isn't on EXACTLY 2 so we need to think a little bit further on.
explanations.C: Not quite - it isn't on EXACTLY 3 so we need to think a little bit before that.
explanations.D: I think you've given the 洧녽 coordinate here which is the axis going up. The 洧논 axis is the one that goes across.

explanations.A: It lines up with -4 on the 洧논 axis and halfway between -3 and -4 on the 洧녽 axis, so it would be (-4, -3.5).
explanations.B: Not quite - the 洧녽 coordinate isn't on EXACTLY -3 so we need to think a little bit further on.
explanations.C: Not quite - if it was -4.5 then it would be halfway between -4 and -5. What will it be if it's halfway between -3 and -4?
explanations.D: I think you've given your coordinate the wrong way around! coordinates should be given as (洧논, 洧녽).

explanations.A: Not quite - if it was -6.5 then it would be halfway between -6 and -7. What will it be if it's halfway between -5 and -6?
explanations.B: I think you've given your coordinate the wrong way around! coordinates should be given as (洧논, 洧녽).
explanations.C: It lines up halfway between -5 and -6 on the 洧논 axis and with -3 on the 洧녽 axis, so it would be (-5.5, -3).
explanations.D: Not quite - the 洧녽 coordinate isn't on EXACTLY -5 so we need to think a little bit further on.

explanations.A: Point A lines up halfway between 4 and 5 on the 洧논 axis and halfway between -3 and -4 on the 洧녽 axis, which would give it the coordinates (4.5, -3.5).
explanations.B: I think you've got your coordinate the wrong way around! coordinates are given as (洧논, 洧녽). Have a look at the labels on the axes to see which one is which.
explanations.C: Not quite - I think you've plotted the coordinate back to front and mixed your signs up. coordinates are given as (洧논, 洧녽). Look carefully at which coordinate is negative and which is positive, and check the labels on the axes to see which one is which!
explanations.D: Not quite - I think you've mixed your signs up. Look carefully at which coordinate is negative and which is positive!

explanations.A: Not quite - I think you've plotted the coordinate back to front and mixed your signs up. coordinates are given as (洧논, 洧녽). Look carefully at which coordinate is negative and which is positive, and check the labels on the axes to see which one is which!
explanations.B: Point B lines up halfway between 2 and 3 on the 洧논 axis and halfway between -5 and -6 on the 洧녽 axis, which would give it the coordinates (2.5, -5.5).
explanations.C: Not quite - I think you've mixed your signs up. Look carefully at which coordinate is negative and which is positive!
explanations.D: I think you've got your coordinate the wrong way around! coordinates are given as (洧논, 洧녽). Have a look at the labels on the axes to see which one is which.

explanations.A: Not quite - I think you've plotted the coordinate back to front and mixed your signs up. coordinates are given as (洧논, 洧녽). Look carefully at which coordinate is negative and which is positive, and check the labels on the axes to see which one is which!
explanations.B: Not quite - I think you've mixed your signs up. Look carefully at which coordinate is negative and which is positive!
explanations.C: I think you've got your coordinate the wrong way around! coordinates are given as (洧논, 洧녽). Have a look at the labels on the axes to see which one is which.
explanations.D: Point D lines up 3/4 of the way between -1 and -2 on the 洧논 axis and halfway between 2 and 3 on the 洧녽 axis, which would give it the coordinates (-1 3/4, 2 1/2).

explanations.A: Not quite - I think you've mixed your signs up. Look carefully at which coordinate is negative and which is positive!
explanations.B: Not quite - I think you've plotted the coordinate back to front and mixed your signs up. coordinates are given as (洧논, 洧녽). Look carefully at which coordinate is negative and which is positive, and check the labels on the axes to see which one is which!
explanations.C: Point C lines up 1/4 way between -4 and -5 on the 洧논 axis and halfway between 3 and 4 on the 洧녽 axis, which would give it the coordinates (- 4 1/4, 3 1/2).
explanations.D: I think you've got your coordinate the wrong way around! coordinates are given as (洧논, 洧녽). Have a look at the labels on the axes to see which one is which.
